title.narrative: Enhancing circularity and sustainability in businesses and value chains

description.narrative:
The business sector, “ranging from microenterprises to cooperatives to multinationals”, is expected to play a pivotal role in achieving the 2030 Agenda and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Companies are called to contribute to the paradigm shift required by being an active source of innovative solutions for tackling the sustainable development challenges. The overall ambition of the SDGs and of the Paris Agreement to decouple economic development from resource consumption and environmental degradation, and to improving wellbeing, translates into a strong and growing need for the tools and services of the private sector. Given their strong connection with grass root level and local communities, Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) are key agents of change and can be a strong source of social and environmental innovation. SMEs are also engines of economic growth and social development; it is therefore crucial that they be empowered to actively contribute to the transition towards sustainability.
This project aims at enabling and supporting businesses, including Small and Medium Enterprises, to increase resource efficiency and to adopt more sustainable and circular practices (which contribute to implementing sound management of chemicals and pay attention to chemicals of concern), thereby strengthening their positioning in value chains and markets. It does by providing a coherent approach to UNEP’s sustainable consumption and production work with businesses, including Small and Medium Enterprises, which leads to increasing the uptake of sustainable and circular practices at company level, promoting innovative solutions and circularity along key value chains and through partnerships, providing science-based knowledge, and creating conducive policy and financial frameworks. The project approach is science-based, holistic and systemic.
